document.docAuthor: Skoracki, Maciej, Hromada, Martin & Unsoeld, Markus
document.docTitle: Neoaulonastus tanzanicus Skoracki, Hromada & Unsoeld, 2013, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new quill mite species of the genus Neoaulonastus Skoracki (Acari: Syringophilidae) parasitizing passerines in Tanzania

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new quill mite species of the genus Neoaulonastus Skoracki (Acari: Syringophilidae) parasitizing passerines in Tanzania

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. FEMALE ( holotype ). Total body length 500 ( 500–520 in 2 paratypes ).
Gnathosoma
. Infracapitulum apunctate. Each medial branch of peritremes with 2 chambers, each lateral branch with 5–6 chambers. Stylophore 120 ( 120–125 ) long.
Idiosoma
. Propodonotal shield weakly sclerotized on anterior margin, bearing bases of setae ve , si and
c 1
, apunctate. Length ratio of setae ve:si 1 : 1 . Setae se and
c 1
situated at same transverse level or setae se set slightly anterior to
c 1
. Hysteronotal shield absent. Setae
c 1
and se subequal in length. Setae
c 1
twice longer than setae
d 2
and 6.4–7.8 times longer than setae
d 1
. Length ratio of setae
d 1
:
d 2
1 : 2.6–3.5 . Pygidial shield weakly sclerotized, apunctate. Length ratio of setae
f 1 :f 2
1 : 4–5 . Length ratio of aggenital setae
ag 1 :ag 2 :ag 3
1.2–1.3 : 1 : 1.4 . Pseudanal setae
ps 2
slightly longer than
ps 1
. Genital setae
g 2
slightly longer than
g 1
. Genital plate absent. Coxal fields III and IV punctate. Setae
3 c
2.3 times longer than
3 b
. Legs . Fan-like setae p’ and p” of legs III and IV with 5 tines. Setae tc’ and tc” of legs III–IV subequal in lengths or setae tc” III–IV slightly longer than tc’ III–IV. Lengths of setae : ve 20 ( 15–20 ), si 20 ( 15–20 ), se 145 ( 135–150 ),
c 1
160 ( 155–160 ),
c 2
150 ( 145–150 ),
d 1
25 ( 20–25 ),
d 2
70 ( 70–80 ),

65
( 65–70 ),

25 ( 25 ),
f 2
( 105–125 ),
h 1
25 ( 25 ),
h 2
290 ,
ps 1
15 ( 15 ),
ps 2
15 ( 15 ),
g 1
25 ( 25 ),
g 2
30 ( 30 ),
ag 1
105 ( 105 ),
ag 2
80 ( 90 ),
ag 3
( 120–125 ), tc’ III–IV ( 30–45 ), tc” III–IV ( 45–50 ),
3 b
20 ( 20 ),
3 c
45 ( 45–50 ).

MALE ( 1 paratype ). Total body length 345 .
Gnathosoma
. Infracapitulum apunctate. Each medial branch of peritremes with 2 chambers, each lateral branch with 6 chambers. Stylophore 95 long.
Idiosoma
. Propodonotal shield weakly sclerotized, bearing bases of setae ve , si and
c 1
, apunctate. Length ratio of setae ve : si 1 : 1 . Setae se situated anterior to level of setae
c 1
. Hysteronotal and pygidial shields absent. Length ratio of setae
f 2 :h 2
1 : 2 . Length ratio of aggenital setae
ag 1 :ag 2
2 : 1 . Setae
g 1
situated anterior to level of setae
g 2
. Setae
3 c
twice longer than
3 b
. Legs . Fan-like setae p’ and p” of legs III and IV with 4 tines. Lengths of setae : ve 10 , si 10 , se 20 ,
c 1
20 ,
c 2
20 ,
d 1
10 ,
d 2
10 ,
e 2
10
,
f 2
20 ,
h 2
40 ,
ag 1
40 ,
ag
2
20, 3b 10, 3c 20 .

Type material.
Female holotype and paratypes :
2 females
,
1 male
, 1 tritonymph, and 3 protonymphs from quills of body feathers of
Euplectes axillaris (Smith)
( Passeriformes : Ploceidae );
TANZANIA
, Arusha, Usa-River,
7 April 1960
, coll. Dr. V. Nagy. Host specimen is deposited in the ZSM (Reg. No. 60.1126 ). Mites removed by M. Skoracki.

Type material deposition.
All material is deposited in the AMU (Reg. No. AMU-SYR. 385 ) except
1 female
paratype in the ZSM (Reg. No. ZSM
20112046
).
Etymology. The specific epithet derives from the type locality—Tanzania.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Neoaulonastus tanzanicus
sp. nov.
, female. A, dorsal view; B, peritremes; C, fan-like seta p’ III; D, ventral view. Scale bars: A, D = 50µm; B, C = 20µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Differential diagnosis.
N. tanzanicus
sp. nov.
is morphologically similar to
N. picidus Skoracki, 2011
. In females of both species setae
f 2
are distinctly longer than
f 1
; the propodonotal shield is present; setae
c 1
are 5–8 times longer than
d 1
. Setae
d 2
are relatively short; the coxal fields III and IV are rarely punctate; the genital plate is absent. This new species differs from
N. picidus
by the following characters: in females of
N. tanzanicus
sp. nov. , the length ratio of setae
d 1
:
d 2
is 1 : 2.6–3.5 ; the hysteronotal shield is absent; each lateral branch of the peritremes has 5–6 chambers; fan-like setae are with 5 tines. In females of
N. picidus
, length ratio of setae
d 1
:
d 2
is 1 : 1 ; the hysteronotal shield is present; each lateral branch of the peritremes has 5–6 chambers; fan-like setae are with 7–8 tines.
